alert.note: Alert for Boone; Carroll; Gallatin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 5:53PM EDT until August 20 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Indiana and Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, in Southeast Indiana, Switzerland. In Northern Kentucky, Boone, Carroll and Gallatin. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 553 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Florence, Carrollton, Walton, Burlington, Oakbrook, Union, Crittenden, Vevay, Warsaw, Kentucky Speedway, Patriot, Glencoe, Ghent, Sanders, Sparta, Worthville, Prestonville and Ethridge.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
